articles.title: Reproducible science workshop
articles.contents:
Who: Olivier Gimenez
When: March 18, 2021
Where: Zoom
Timeline
Motivations
Manipulating data in the tidyverse
Visualising data in the tidyverse
Writing dynamic and reproducible documents with R Markdown
Versioning with Git and GitHub in RStudio
Take-home messages
Requirements
You will need a GitHub account, you can easily set up a free account here.
To run the workshop materials on your machine, you will need:
The latest version of R, download here.
The latest version of RStudio, download here.
The following R packages: tidyverse, sf, emo, janitor, palmerpenguins, usethis and lubridate. You can install them all at once by running the following code in the R command line:



install.packages(c("tidyverse", "sf", "emo", "janitor", "palmerpenguins", "usethis", "lubridate"))



Corrections
If you see mistakes or want to suggest changes, please create an issue on the source repository.
